Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimize a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints. The most fundamental and widely taught type.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: An LP where some or all decision variables are constrained to be integers. Adds combinatorial complexity.
Example: generally difficult. Solvable for many practical instances with modern solvers.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Minimize a convex objective function over a convex set. A broad class with very favorable properties.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimize a nonlinear objective function subject to nonlinear constraints. A very broad and difficult class.
Solvability: Generally NP-Hard. Difficulty highly dependent on problem structure.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: A special case of NLP where the objective function is quadratic and constraints are linear.
Solvability: Efficiently solvable if the objective is convex (P). NP-Hard if indefinite.

Name: Constraint Satisfaction Problem
Description: Find an assignment of values to variables that satisfies a given set of constraints

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty. Parameters are known only by their probability distributions.

Name: Robust Optimization
Description: Seeks solutions that are feasible for the worst-case realization of uncertain parameters within a defined set.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: A field concerned with problems where the set of feasible solutions is discrete or can be reduced to discrete. MILP is a primary technique.
